revised_title: Observations of Lunar Rainbows by Marmaduke Tunstall
tldr: Marmaduke Tunstall observed and documented three instances of lunar rainbows, or lunar irides, in a short period. These phenomena occur when light is refracted in a cloud or turbid atmosphere and are often indicators of stormy and rainy weather. Tunstall's observations provide valuable insights into the nature and occurrence of these rare events.
